name: Novotel Cairns Oasis Resort

reviews.text: I travel to Cairns frequently where as one might expect, there are a number of hotels to choose from. This hotel used to be a very nice place to stay in Cairns & I have stayed at this property on numerous occasions over the past few years. Sadly, my most recent three stays during the last six months have resulted in my deciding to look elsewhere for accomodation whenever I visit Cairns. That is, until such time as MAJOR improvements are made.
reviews.title: Used to be a Good Place to Stay in Cairns.. Not anymore!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The following comments are based upon my experiences during the previous three visits.
reviews.title: Novotel Cairns Good Value

reviews.text: Restaraunt - Was great. Is not anymore! As an a example, the dinner buffet service which used to be offered in the evening was very attractive and inviting is now rarely if ever, (from what I have been told / experienced) offered. The menu now on offer is over priced, poorly presented and very limited.
reviews.title: Average Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pool - Was wonderful. Is not anymore. Now not well maintained. Pool towels to be seen strewn around the pool area in the morning having not been cleared away by stafff the previous evening, used cups, etc. left on tables along with various items of rubbish...
reviews.title: Sorry, we don't have the room you booked; so you can go somewhere else if you like

reviews.text: Room - Carpets stained, problems with aircon, generally look tired and in need of renovation.
reviews.title: Average hotel close to the esplanade

reviews.text: Great location, except for the fruit bats in the trees. The staff were very helpful and answered all requests. Restaurant food was very good. The pool area was excellent. The room was average, could do with a little make-over, particularly the air-conditioner. Overall good value for money.
reviews.title: Cairns Novotel Oasis

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms need a renovation. Carpet full of stains, sofa uncomfy, wicker chairs start getting holes in seating part. Location perfect, very close to Esplanade and shops. Secure underground parking. Pool with swim-up bar is huge and lots of shady spots available around the pool.
reviews.title: Relaxing in CBD Cairns

reviews.text: We stayed at the Novotel for 4 nights with our 2 children. The room was clean and big enough for all of us and the bathroom a good size. Shower wasn't great though. The beds were so comfortable!! The kids loved the huge pool outside (they said it was a bit cold but is was in winter!) I love that they provided towels for the pool too! Breakfast was fantastic! Staff were helpful and friendly. Coronas were cheap in the bar area. We also got our room at a really good rate too! Awesome location, can walk anywhere in the city. Next time we go to Cairns I would consider staying here.
reviews.title: Great Location, Fantastic Pool and Spacious Room

reviews.text: Very clean, tidy and well set out.
reviews.title: TWO DAY STOPOVER IN CAIRNS

reviews.text: Stayed here for 4 nights in July 2013. It seems to be a popular hub for tourists to the region judging by the numbers of tourists in the reception area waiting for tours. The pool area was huge and it even has a beach area at one end. The hotel itself was everything you'd expect of a modern hotel. The beds were comfortable and there is a well-stocked minibar. I was visiting on business, but I'd happily spend a holiday there. It's a short walk to the Esplanade and the City Centre.
reviews.title: Good Hotel close to amenities
Could do better
reviews.text: The room service breakfast was well prepared, delivered on time and was what I expected (good).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reception was very efficient considering that I had to check out in a hurry to catch an early flight.
reviews.title: Great hotel close to the city centre!

reviews.text: This hotel is quite close to the esplanade and all the restaurants there, so a nice central location. It's about 10 mins drive to the airport.
reviews.title: Comfy beds!
Not what it used to be
reviews.text: Overall I thought the hotel was good quality, with very comfortable beds. Its a shame the bathrooms were a little tired, and like all hotels in north QLD - overpriced. All in all though a solid choice and about what you;d expect from the Novotel brand.

The pool area was lovely and the little pool side bar had excellent service. The breakfast had a reasonable variety, but could have benefited from some pancakes. I was very worried when we arrived as the room backed onto a little park that was filled with fruit bats that were extremely noisy, but the soundproofing on the room was great and you couldn't hear them at all once the door was closed.
reviews.title: Worn and run down

description: Centrally located in the heart of Cairns the multi award winning Novotel Cairns Oasis Resort is situated on 2.5 hectares of tropical gardens and boasts the largest lagoon style pool in the city centre, complete with its own white sandy beach and swim up bar.All 314 rooms offer contemporary style accommodation with a balcony or terrace overlooking the city, gardens or pool. Facilities also include a free web corner with the latest IMAC technology, free wi fi (lobby area only), 24 hour in balance gym, onsite hairdresser and Massage & Beauty. The hotel also offers 24 hour room service and reception.Mizuna Restaurant offers buffet breakfast daily and of an evening boasts modern À la carte dining. Aqua Bar serves afternoon drinks, lunch and light bites by the pool whilst Novo Bar opens at 5:00pm daily for pre-dinner cocktails, evening drinks or night time snack menu.The hotel is within walking distance to the Reef Casino and Reef Terminal and only one block from both the Esplanade including 'Muddy’s', Cairns modern, fun, safe playground and parkland.
